thread.title: Real Madrid defender Sergio Ramos gets an astonishing amount of height from jump to slam dunk basketball
thread.title_full: Real Madrid defender Sergio Ramos gets an astonishing amount of height from jump to slam dunk basketball

author: Jake Polden
title: Real Madrid defender Sergio Ramos gets an astonishing amount of height from jump to slam dunk basketball
text:
Sport Real Madrid defender Sergio Ramos gets an astonishing amount of height from jump to slam dunk basketball He might only be six foot but the Los Blancos star may have a career in the NBA after he hangs up his football boots Share Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Sergio Ramos gets astonishing height from jump to slam dunk basketball Share this video Get Real Madrid CF   Thank you for subscribing!   
He's towered over many a defender to score a late headed goal during his time for Real Madrid. 
So it really shouldn't come as much surprise to see Sergio Ramos leap high into the air to slam dunk a basketball with ease. 
What makes the clip - which has been slowed down to showcase the defender's athleticism - so impressive is the fact that Ramos stands at just six foot. 
So it's not even as if he is super tall, like those who make a living from scoring baskets in a similar way in the NBA. Sergio Ramos gains momentum (Photo: sr4oficial/Instagram) The defender leaps into the air with the ball (Photo: sr4oficial/Instagram) 
Ramos posted the video to social media, along with the caption: "Preparing for the All Star of the NBA. Getting ready for the All Star game." 
He added, calling out the one and only Cleveland Cavaliers star LeBron James in the process: "Can you top that? @kingjames". 
This is not the first time Ramos has demonstrated his love for the sport, having previously posted images of himself scoring a basket. Getting closer to the basket... (Photo: sr4oficial/Instagram) Slam dunk (Photo: sr4oficial/Instagram) 
He seems to have a knack for the game, but not everyone is convinced by his ability. 
Some have posted comments alongside the video asking why the defender's feet haven't been captured in the video. 
The suggestion is that the Champions League winner has bounced on a small trampoline ahead of diving into the air to make the dunk. 
But you can be your own judge. poll loading Did Sergio Ramos use a trampoline? 0+ VOTES SO FAR Definitely not, he jumps that high regularly on a football pitch I think so, why else were his feet left out of the video? Like us on Facebook
